description.plain:
BJ the Chicago Kid is an American singer songwriter from the South Side of Chicago, Illinois. Born November 23rd, 1984 as Bryan James Sledge, BJ is best known for his his critically acclaimed album In My Mind, as well as his collaborations with artists such as Chance the Rapper, Kanye West, and Kendrick Lamar.

BJ first appeared on a Dave Hollister record in 2001. Leading up to his debut mixtape, A Taste of Chicago, he would perform on Stevie Wonder’s 2005 album, A Time to Love. Additionally, he was featured on Kanye’s 2006 “Impossible”, which also features Twista and Keyshia Cole.

He released A Taste of Chicago in 2009, followed closely by The New Beginning in the same year. He would also appear on “Faith” by Kendrick Lamar (2009). In 2011, BJ released his third mixtape, The Life of Love’s Cupid. Then, in 2012, he independently released his debut studio album, Pineapple Now-Later. After getting signed by Motown, he would released a 2013 Christmas-themed EP called A Soulful Christmas. In the same year, he appeared on Chance the Rapper’s Acid Rap on “Good Ass Intro”. In 2014, he released a mixtape titled The M.A.F.E Project.

Bj released his first album with Motown, In My Mind, in 2016. The album would peak at #7 on the Billboard top R&B/Hip-hop album chart, and #43 on the Billboard 200. It would bring BJ three Grammy nominations and widespread critical acclaim.

1123 was released on July 26th, 2019. It featured artists such as Anderson .Paak, Bas, JID, Rick Ross, and Offset.

songs.title: Church

description.plain:
BJ The Chicago Kid, Chance The Rapper, and Buddy try to balance “Church” with temptation.

The song is about a steamy love affair that has BJ ensnared, despite his desire to stay out of trouble. It is filled with religious and Biblical references, a deliberate juxtaposition with the sensual nature of the song.

Featured artist Chance the Rapper and BJ previously collaborated on “Good Ass Intro”, “Everybody’s Something” and on two tracks on The Social Experiment’s Surf.

The sample for this song is “Sunny” by James Brown.

songs.full_title: The New Cupid by BJ the Chicago Kid (Ft. Kendrick Lamar)
songs.title: The New Cupid

description.plain:
BJ the Chicago Kid and Kendrick Lamar link up once again. This time for “The New Cupid,” a song about how love slowly is being replaced by one night stands. ‘Cupid’ spends more time in the club nowadays then he spreads love.

BJ The Chicago Kid and Kendrick also collaborated on the song called “His Pain II” from BJ’s first album Pineapple Now-Laters,  and on several songs from Kendrick’s projects before good kid, m.A.A.d city.

The song samples Raphael Saadiq’s “Oh Girl,” and BJ told Genius in an annotation that Saadiq is actually on the recording as well.

The textured beat also contains some classic ‘70s Soul samples. Listen for the vocal sample from “Mr. Big Stuff” by Jean Knight and the drums from “Walk On By” by Isaac Hayes.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ooYExfw9lLY

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iqR4CZj0mJQ

songs.full_title: Dream II by BJ the Chicago Kid
songs.title: Dream II

description.plain: Almost built entirely on this Will Smith interview where he’s speaking a great deal about his work ethic, his talents (or lack thereof) and his successes, this is a straight up homage to putting your head down and working. Your gifts and natural abilities might not get you there, but grit and determination and persistence, beat pure talent any day.

Your gifts and natural abilities might not get you there, but grit and determination and persistence, beat pure talent any day.

songs.lyrics:
Dream II Lyrics[Will Smith]
"I've never really viewed myself as particularly talented. Where I excel is ridiculous, sickening work ethic, you know? While the other guy's sleepin', I'm workin'. While the other guy's eatin', I'm workin'. I have a great time with my life and I wanna share it."
Most people wake up if you ever turn the (lights on)
Cause it mess's up their dreams, they get mad like a (python)
Just like you, I'm tryna live my life (right)
And in the fight of life turn on the (lights)
And if you do that, then you'll be fine
Cause I remember dreaming, dreaming as a kid of me getting older
And exactly what I'mma do
I had to get ready cause I didn't know what time or place
To make my dreams come true
Then later onnnnnn...

I learned that you can't talk to losers bout winning
It ain't their language, they ain't never gonna get it
& Anything I can think of, I can make it come true
Just look @ me now I'm on DREAM II

My nigga Rico Love said turn the lights on
Cause you can see the truth a whole lot better with the lights on
Don't be afraid to turn the lights on
I've learned to dream with the lights on

[Will Smith]
"I want my life, I want my work, I want my family to mean something. If you are not making someone else's life better, then you're wasting your time."
"The first step before anyone else in the world believes it is you have to believe it. There's no reason to have a Plan B because it distracts from Plan A."

You just gotta find
Just let your ?
So I'll take it from here

And I've learned you can't tell everybody your plans
Cause sometime your dreams are bigger than them
You just gotta find your own place to grow
& just let your actions show them

So take it from me
You might also likeI learned that you can't talk to losers bout winning
It ain't their language, they ain't never gonna get it
& Anything I can think of, I can make it come true
Just look @ me now I'm on DREAM II

My nigga Rico love say turn the light on
Cause you can see the truth a whole lot better with the lights on
Don't be afraid to turn the lights on
I've learned to dream with the lights on

[Will Smith]
"Greatness, is not this wonderful, esoteric, illusive, god-like feature that only the special among us will ever taste
You know? It's something that truly exists, in, all of us. It's very simple, this is what I believe, and, I'm willing to die for it. Period. It's that simple"
"I know who I am, I know what I believe, and that's all I need to know."3Embed

songs.artist_names: BJ the Chicago Kid (Ft. Hannibal Buress & Joey Bada$$)
songs.full_title: Nothin But Love by BJ the Chicago Kid (Ft. Hannibal Buress & Joey Bada$$)
songs.title: Nothin But Love
songs.title_with_featured: Nothin But Love (Ft. Hannibal Buress & Joey Bada$$)

description.plain:
“Nothin But Love” is another offering from BJ The Chicago Kid’s upcoming major label debut In My Mind which is set to be out on Motown this Fall. BJ premiered the song along with Fader.com on August 6th, 2015.

https://twitter.com/BJTHECHICAGOKID/status/629412503760453632

The song explains the unconditional “love” that BJ’s has for his woman and how she “completes him” despite all of the things she does that might “piss him off.”

For this track BJ borrows the “I got nothin' but love for you baby…” hook from Heavy D & The Boyz' 1994 classic “Nuttin But Love.”

description.plain: This “Get Away” record brings a midwest harmony slow jam type vibe to the album, continuing a pattern of it throughout. Brings out a side of J.I.D and Buddy as a feature that we are not used to and they work it to perfection. Beautiful production, and all over the track is love.

description.plain:
BJ The Chicago Kid with a modern remake of The World Is A Ghetto by War. While Bj himself brings more soul to the first verse and the hook – he recruits Kendrick Lamar for a verse about all the misery in the world.

This remake also contains a sample of Stevie Wonder’s “Higher Ground”

songs.full_title: Woman's World by BJ the Chicago Kid
songs.title: Woman’s World

description.plain:
This is a “Woman’s World” is a play on James Brown’s “It’s A Man’s World.” BJ explains this ode to the women:

I ain’t nothing without my parents. My parents are the stars. They are the heroes. They are the champions—I’m not the champion. You looking at what I did, but how am I here?! We only hear man’s world. And he yells the shit out of that part. Even though he yells, we don’t listen to it. It’s fucking crazy.

songs.full_title: It's True by BJ the Chicago Kid (Ft. ScHoolboy Q)
songs.title: It’s True

description.plain: Last fall, BJ The Chicago Kid engaged in a massive roll-out of promotion tracks for his The M.A.F.E. Project. While the mixtape served as his first full-length effort in nearly two years, the Illinois and California singer-rapper gave fans a nice balance of R&B sounds mixed in with hip-hop. The Chicago Kid drops off his latest video from the project entitled “It’s True” with Top Dawg Entertainments own, Schoolboy Q. In follow-up to their GRAMMY-nominated hit “Studio,” mash out with the two through the ChiRaq streets to Harold’s Chicken and beyond.

songs.title_with_featured: Can't Hold My Liquor / It's True (Ft. ScHoolboy Q)

description.plain:
BJ The Chicago Kid drops a remix of the popular Kanye West song; “Hold My Liquor” over the production of another song from Yeezus, “I’m In It”. Released on 7th of October.

The version on the mixtape combines the song together with “It’s True”.

https://twitter.com/BJTHECHICAGOKID/status/519539059610230784

BJ made video’s for both songs, “Can’t Hold My Liqour” was the first – released before the M.A.F.E. project.

After the release of the album, BJ also made a video for “It’s True” – starring both him and ScHoolboy Q.

description.plain: To prevent a fatal argument, BJ wants a mistress to “Wait Til The Morning” before revealing his infidelity so he and his woman can talk it out in a more productive setting. It is a story of relational hardships and unfortunate circumstances that culminate to the final stanza where we are lead to believe that this argument is about to commence.

songs.full_title: Real Love Never Dies by BJ the Chicago Kid
songs.title: Real Love Never Dies

description.plain:
BJ released this demo track along with an accompanying video on September 10th 2014. In the video’s description, this song is described as an homage to James Brown’s “King Heroin.”



The track is currently available as a free download on BJ’s website and you can peep the video below:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jNo8R2gjyD0&feature=youtu.be

description.plain:
BJ lets us know what he means with motivational song “Man Down;”

You could put the song’s concept into one sentence. This isn’t my rock song but it’s a song that can bring the excitement. You find your aggression. You find your swag. You get your momentum back. This is one of those records. It’s a record that pretty much confirms what you already know about yourself—you’re kicking ass.

songs.full_title: One In A Million by BJ the Chicago Kid
songs.title: One In A Million

description.plain:
BJ The Chicago kid both covers and adds his own twist onto the classic Aaliyah record “One In A Million”. He also pays tribute to R&B Thug by R. Kelly and Jodeci’s Feenin'

All lyrics highlighted in blue are from the original records and clicking on there will open a new link where you can see the annotations for those lines.

The second part of the record sees BJ covering R. Kelly’s R&B Thug – using some of the lyrics and the same flow, and ultimately ends it with a cover of Jodeci’s Feenin' – adding dedication to a girl from his home state of Illinois.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H5QPahD5SlQ

songs.lyrics:
Home Lyrics[Intro]
I might not always agree with everything that I understand but I understand
Somebody the other day asked me about how I feel about home
The state of home
Well I'll say it like this
Ever been coming home after a long day at work and you see that gas station or that corner store
And you stop there and get your last few things before you go in for the night
And you feel safe before you actually reach your home
So now imagine coming home and that store is burned down
And that gas station is boarded up
It removes that feeling of safe, that feeling of comfort
That feeling of home before you actually reach your home
Me, personally, I would never want to destroy that feeling before I reach my home
If I destroy that feeling or that feeling is destroyed by someone else, I would wanna move
So why would I wanna destroy home
Home is all we got
Home is where the heart is
In my mind, here's home
I wanna go to the places I know (I know)
I'd love to show you the places I go (I go)
Wish you could see where I be

Back home to Chicago
I know you think it’s crazy there

Make it home make it home
Back home to Chicago

I'mma sing the song like it’s my last

songs.artist_names: BJ the Chicago Kid (Ft. Anderson .Paak & Ty Dolla $ign)
songs.full_title: Church (West Coast Remix) by BJ the Chicago Kid (Ft. Anderson .Paak & Ty Dolla $ign)
songs.title: Church (West Coast Remix)
songs.title_with_featured: Church (West Coast Remix) (Ft. Anderson .Paak & Ty Dolla $ign)

description.plain:
The West Coast Remix to BJ The Chicago Kid’s “Church” naturally features two hot Californian artists. Unlike the original song, which featured a full verse from fellow Chicago native Chance The Rapper and a short bridge from Compton native Buddy, each artist draws inspiration from R&B to have a groovy verse.

A Chicago Remix was also released alongside the West Coast Remix. “Church (Chicago Remix)” features Jeremih and Lil Durk.

Ty Dolla $ign brings a mellow verse about his sexual bond with a girl, whilst Anderson .Paak lays some soothing vocals filled with Biblical references over the gentle beat. BJ The Chicago Kid’s also blesses the track with a fresh verse.

songs.artist_names: BJ the Chicago Kid (Ft. Freddie Gibbs)
songs.full_title: B.A.M. by BJ the Chicago Kid (Ft. Freddie Gibbs)
songs.title: B.A.M.

description.plain:
A song about bad bitches (B.A.M. = Badder than a Motherfucker) by BJ The Chicago Kid and Freddie Gibbs – who have collaborated frequent recently. The song was also recorded in the same period Gibbs was working on Piñata.

Freddie and I were actually neighbors when we recorded this song, I lived five minutes away from his crib in downtown LA. I rode my bike to his crib, and we did the record in one night.

This song has a modern style – like Wednesday Weekend and his remix of Hold My Liquor. The song, featured on his upcoming M.A.F.E. project is contrary to most of his earlier songs and his debut album Pineapple Now-Laters.

description.plain:
“Crazy” isn’t about mental illness, but about being crazy about something. Whether it’s being crazy in love or being crazy to fight for something you want, as long as you are crazy for something BJ will rock with you.

So at the end of the day man, get crazy about something

body.plain: The intro of In My Mind is a brief look into BJ’s mind. BJ seems to be a God loving, romantic, funny guy – but to fully understand his mind you need to listen to the whole album.

songs.lyrics:
Intro (Inside My Mind) Lyrics[Verse]
I love God
But I also love mob movies
I don't agree with everything I understand
But I understand it
The only things I'm afraid of
Is losing someone I love, God, and spiderwebs
I'm not afraid of failing
As a matter of fact I failed so many time
Before my first run around the bases
You wouldn't believe it
That's what taught me to respect the success
Trust what you know
Rock with your folks
But take no prisonersYou might also like2Embed

songs.title: Go Girl

description.plain:
BJ released this track on August 31st. Featuring Kobe, the smooth vocals serve as an ode to all the beautiful women trying to earn their keep at the club.



Currently, you can download the song for free from BJ’s website.

songs.full_title: Wednesday Weekend by BJ the Chicago Kid

description.plain: Already the fifth song released by BJ The Chicago Kid on his Soundcloud Account. Another song that doesn’t fit BJ’s recognizable old-school Soul style. It leans toward trap music but Mike&Keys and BJ made it much softer than most music in this style.

A song by BJ The Chicago Kid and Smoke DZA, where BJ was talking with Freddie Gibbs about bad bitches. The subject is now weed, women and a combination of those two.



The song is the 11th song on BJ’s mixtape The M.A.F.E. Project. BJ and Smoke DZA have earlier collaborated on Robin Givens.
